column4: http://pastebin.com/m3a38fe08 i tihnk it's the boot partition that's running out of room :(
'df -h' and see how much space is left
thats huge for a boot partition
maybe i have to delete some of those files?
do uname -a and see what kernel version you are running
Linux sonja 2.6.24-17-generic #1 SMP Thu May 1 14:31:33 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
maybe my boot partition is not deleting old kernels?
its not really designed to iirc
you will need to go into synaptic and remove your old kernels
so the user has to know how to clean it up once in a while.... or have a huge boot partition and not worry about it
this may be brutal but find the oldest kernel version in /boot and just rm the kernel-* file for it
so  i would type something like  move /boot/kernel-*  in terminal?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/38120/ that's the list of files in /boot/
no, just do mv kernel-(earliest version there) /root/
you will need a sudo in front of it
